SENT.plain: Pulmonary arterio-venous fistula is a rare congenital lesion of the pulmonary vasculature, causing cyanosis in children
The lesion can be solitary or multiple, usually involves the lower lobes and is often associated with the Rendu-Osler-Weber syndrome
The case of a 9-year-old boy is reported in whom diagnosis was made on pulmonary angiophotoscintigraphy and confirmed at angiography
The usual treatment of choice of these lesions is lobectomy which promptly relieves the symptoms
